page.title: 20Norton farming
page.content: At first sight much of the land in the Norton area has not changed in use or appearance.But with the slow encroach- ing influence of the nearby city of Stoke-on-Trent alterations have and still are taking place. Although not on the massive scale of earlier this century, land is still being taken for residential use.Farmers find it harder to make a living on the reduced acreages,especially on the cold clay soil.Few crops are grown,even on land that once grew wheat,most farmers concentrate on cattle for meat or dairy use. Some farms cease to live up to that name,the owners of the land either renting it out for city dwellers' horses or allowing grass to grow then cutting it and selling the hay whilst they carry on a separate business. Other farms remain emtpy and vandalised since their previous owner has died.
